Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP server using Netty framework, capable of handling HTTP requests with configurable thread pools and graceful shutdown capabilities.

Class Description: NettySourceHttpServer is a TCP server implementation using Netty framework that handles HTTP requests. It manages server lifecycle (initialization, startup, shutdown) and uses configurable thread pools for handling connections. The server can be initialized with specific query registry and event subject for request processing.

Attributes:
- workerGroup: [NioEventLoopGroup] - Handles I/O operations and other tasks for accepted connections
- bossGroup: [NioEventLoopGroup] - Accepts incoming connections with configurable thread count
- nettyServerRunnable: [Runnable] - Contains the server startup logic
- isInitialized: [boolean] - Tracks whether the server has been initialized
- isStarted: [boolean] - Tracks whether the server is running

Methods:
- [Constructor]([Context context, int threadCount]) -> [void] - Initializes bossGroup with specified thread count and workerGroup with default settings
- init([QueryRegistry queryRegistry, Subject<String, String> eventSubject, int port]) -> [void] - Configures server bootstrap with HTTP handlers and binding port if not already initialized
- startServer() -> [void] - Starts the server in a separate thread if initialized but not running, adds shutdown hook
- shutdownServer() -> [void] - Gracefully shuts down server resources if initialized and running
